item.title: 14 selling drugs | 13th May 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01,Â the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed violating his conditional order by...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01,Â the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed violating his conditional order by pacing outside Flat 15â€™s door, a behavior noted to occur daily. During this time, a suspected drug transaction took place in plain view of the front door camera. An individual on a pushbike approached, exchanged money for a small packet containing a white substance with the resident, who then returned inside. Previous observations and reports indicate ongoing drug-related activity at Flat 14, including suspicious visitors, disturbances, and direct witnessing of similar transactions.

Reported To:
WDH (now vico homes) | The Police | Logged on this CMS

Details:
On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01, the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed exiting his flat, immediately walking and loitering in front of Flat Number 15.
This is in violation of his conditional order yet is quickly becoming a more frequent daily occurrence.
The resident was seen pacing for approximately three minutes outside Flat 15.
During this time, a suspected drug transaction was captured on the front door camera.
An individual wearing either a balaclava or a black cap and hoodie arrived on a pushbike.
The resident of Flat 14 retrieved a small packet containing a white substance from his pocket and held it while the individual on the bicycle produced money.
The two then exchanged items: the resident handed over the packet and accepted the cash before returning inside.

Additional Context:
* There have been ongoing concerns regarding suspected drug activity at Flat 14 for years now.
* The resident has been overheard, through the bathroom ceiling, speaking on the phone about selling cocaine and storing proceeds in a digital account called “nest”.
* Individuals with suspicious behavior have previously approached us, inquiring about the resident of number 14 and expressing a need to “get some stuff.”
* There have been multiple incidents of disturbances, including a anorexic woman in distress shouting and banging at Flat 14â€™s door, reportedly due to an inability to purchase substances.
* Both us and other neighbors have witnessed suspected drug transactions at Flat 14â€™s door on several occasions.

Video:
The first three minutes of the residentâ€™s pacing have been condensed in the attached video for brevity.
The footage then slows to normal speed to clearly show the arrival of the individual on the pushbike and the subsequent exchange.
This incident is consistent with an ongoing pattern of suspected drug-related activity and repeated breaches of the residentâ€™s conditional order.

item.title: Typical Activity Example | 10th May 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On May 10th, 2025, routine yet frequent foot traffic and activity were observed around Flat Number 14. Throughout the...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On May 10th, 2025, routine yet frequent foot traffic and activity were observed around Flat Number 14. Throughout the day, two individuals-a male in a grey hoodie with camouflage trousers and a shirtless male (later seen wearing a shirt)-were repeatedly seen approaching Flat 14â€™s door and lingering in the vicinity. Notably, both individuals frequently looked at Flat Number 15â€™s door, bins, and camera, often pausing to observe these areas as they moved about.
While it is not standard practice for us to log daily foot traffic, this report serves as an example of the typical activity and comings and goings associated with Flat 14, where various individuals are regularly seen entering, exiting, and loitering near the premises.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS

Details and Timeline:
On May 10th, 2025, throughout the day,
05:10 AM: Male wearing a grey hoodie (hood up) and camouflage trousers approached Flat 14â€™s door.
05:11 AM: The same individual (grey hoodie) left, walking past the front camera.
05:34 AM: Grey hoodie male returned and again went to Flat 14â€™s door.
05:35 AM: Grey hoodie male left, passing the front camera.
08:25 AM: Resident of Flat 14 exited the building, wearing a cap, black track pants, black jacket, and a backpack.
09:01 AM: Resident of Flat 14 returned, captured via the side camera.
11:08 AM: Shirtless male (previously seen on May 9th, 2025) walked towards Flat 14â€™s door, captured on the front camera.
11:09 AM: Shirtless male appeared on the side camera.
11:09 AM: Shirtless male appeared again on the side camera.
11:11 AM: Shirtless male appeared on the side camera.
11:11 AM: Shirtless male observed walking around outside, pacing back and forth to Flat 14â€™s door.
11:12 AM: Shirtless male appeared on the side camera.
11:12 AM: Shirtless male continued pacing back and forth outside.
11:13 AM: Shirtless male appeared again on the side camera.
11:14 AM: Shirtless male observed walking around, swinging his shirt.
11:15 AM: Shirtless male walked around, then returned towards Flat 14â€™s door.
11:19 AM: Shirtless male continued walking around, back and forth.
11:20 AM: Shirtless male continued walking around, then returned.
11:20 AM: Shirtless male stood at the grass edge on his phone while walking around, then moved off camera towards Flat 14.
11:22 AM: Shirtless male continued walking around while on his phone.
11:23 AM: Shirtless male, still on the phone and swinging his shirt, was joined by the resident of Flat 14; both stood at the curb talking. Shirtless male then walked away, and the resident returned to Flat 14.
12:33 PM: Grey hoodie male (same as earlier) returned to Flat 14â€™s door.
12:35 PM: Grey hoodie male walked away, carrying something in his hand.
04:58 PM: Resident of Flat 14 walked away, passing the front camera.
05:34 PM: Resident of Flat 14 walked past, checking behind him and looking at the reporting partyâ€™s door, followed by the shirtless male (from earlier and the previous day).
05:35 PM: Shirtless male observed outside, looking at the bins and front door area while walking around smoking. He moved off camera, then returned near the reporting partyâ€™s door, appeared to talk to the resident of Flat 14, then left toward Flat 14â€™s bins and exited past the front camera.
05:36 PM: Resident of Flat 14 went to a white car parked on the corner, spoke to the driver, made arm motions, then walked back towards his door, waved the car off, and went back inside.
05:55 PM: Shirtless male, now wearing a shirt, was seen looking at Flat 14â€™s window.
06:24 PM: Shirtless male stood on the grass, looking up at Flat 14â€™s window.
06:25:53 PM: Shirtless male walked to the curb, then back to Flat 14â€™s door.
06:26 PM: Shirtless male stood on the grass, looking around and up at the window again.
06:27 PM: Shirtless male stood looking at the reporting partyâ€™s door and then at his phone, before leaving past the bins.
06:28 PM: Shirtless male returned, went to Flat 14â€™s door.
06:28 PM: Shirtless male, on his phone, looked at Flat 14â€™s window, then walked away past the bins while still on his phone.
07:27 PM: Grey hoodie male walked past towards Flat 14â€™s door.
07:28 PM: Grey hoodie male walked near the reporting partyâ€™s door, looked up at Flat 14â€™s window, then returned towards Flat 14â€™s door.
08:28 PM: Grey hoodie male reappeared on camera, looking at Flat 14â€™s bins and window.
08:28 PM: Grey hoodie male walked back, stared at Flat 14â€™s window again, then returned to Flat 14â€™s door.
08:29 PM: Grey hoodie male left, going past the bins.
08:30 PM: Grey hoodie male returned towards Flat 14â€™s door.
08:48 PM: Grey hoodie male left again, passing the bins.
08:49 PM: Grey hoodie male returned again to Flat 14â€™s door.
09:03 PM: Grey hoodie male walked away, passing the bins.
09:04 PM: Grey hoodie male returned again to Flat 14â€™s door.
09:57 PM: Grey hoodie male left, walking back past the bins.

Observations:
* The grey hoodie male and shirtless male were regularly present throughout the day, demonstrating a consistent pattern of movement and interaction around Flat 14.
*Â Both individuals frequently looked at and lingered near our door, bins, and camera, suggesting a heightened interest in our property.
* The shirtless maleâ€™s presence on consecutive days suggests ongoing activity linked to Flat 14.
* The general environment around Flat 14 is characterized by a high volume of visitors and transient individuals, with people regularly entering, exiting, and loitering near the property.
* These behaviors appear to represent the typical foot traffic and activity associated with Flat 14 on this date.

Video:

item.title: Suspicious Activity | 9th May 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On May 9th, 2025, their were two separate logs, one in the morning with a friend of the resident...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On May 9th, 2025, their were two separate logs, one in the morning with a friend of the resident of number 14 looking at our door, and another in the evening with the resident of number 14 and the same person from the morning displaying suspicious behavior around our property and bin area, followed by the other personâ€™s departure.
* At 11:30 A friend of the resident of flat Number 14 was seen walking slowly near the front area of the flat and looking at our door.
– approached Number 14â€™s door, captured briefly on the side camera, left while checking his phone.
* At 22:25 The resident of flat Number 14 returned home with another individual.
– other person could be someone whom the resident sold a bicycle months ago, who works for the council, or it could be the person who was involved in a prior door-related incident.
– Both individuals walked past our property. pointing towards our bins and talking.
* At 22:26: Number 14 was seen walking slowly to the corner, then returning towards his own door while repeatedly glancing at our door and bin area.
– This behavior was similar to actions he took before receiving a police caution.
* At 22:27: The other person walked past our door and left the area, He was not seen again that evening.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS

Details:
On May 9th, 2025, at approximately 22:25, the resident of flat Number 14 was observed returning home accompanied by another individual.
This individual appeared to be someone previously seen with the resident earlier that morning.
We believe this person may be the same individual to whom the resident sold a bicycle a few months ago, who is known to work for the council, or possibly the person involved in a prior incident where an associate of the resident attempted to open our door while the resident observed from a distance.
Both individuals walked past our property, with the resident of Number 14 pointing/gesturing towards our bins and appearing to talk with the other person.
After passing, the resident returned alone.
At 22:26, he was seen walking slowly to the corner before returning towards his own door, repeatedly glancing at our door and bin area.
This behavior is consistent with actions he exhibited prior to receiving a police caution.
At 22:27, the other individual was observed walking past our door and leaving the premises. He was not seen again that evening.

Earlier that day (approximately 11 hours earlier), a friend of the resident of Number 14 was observed slowly walking near the front area of the flat and examining our door. He approached Number 14â€™s door and was also captured on the side camera before departing, appearing to check his phone as he left.
Although the side camera only recorded a few seconds, the footage has been included towards the end of the attached video for reference.

Video:

item.title: Suspicious Behavior | 10th April 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On April 10th, 2025, at approximately 02:00, * Loud banging noises heard from Flat Number 14 starting around 2:00...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On April 10th, 2025, at approximately 02:00,
* Loud banging noises heard from Flat Number 14 starting around 2:00 AM, lasting intermittently until approximately 4:00 AM.
* Initial disturbance lasted 10 to 15 minutes before temporarily stopping, then resumed shortly before 3:00 AM.
* At approximately 2:59 AM, the resident exited his flat and walked past your front door to the edge of the grass near the bins, moving just out of camera view.
* He returned slowly and repeated this action at 3:01 AM, although his return was not fully captured on camera.
* At 3:01 AM, the resident was seen walking along the side of your flat (via living room camera), appearing to spit on or blow kisses at the window while looking directly at the CCTV.
* He walked past your flat slowly again, then moved toward the road near the bins, out of camera view.
* The resident was later seen returning to his flat, where loud banging noises resumed for an additional 10 to 20 minutes.
* Camera footage of these events covers the period between 2:59 AM and 3:03 AM.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS

Details:
On April 10th, 2025, at approximately 02:00, loud banging noises were heard coming from Flat Number 14.
This disturbance continued for approximately 10 to 15 minutes before temporarily ceasing. The banging resumed shortly before 03:00.

At approximately 02:59, the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed exiting his flat and walking past our front door to the edge of the grass near our bins, moving just out of the cameraâ€™s view. He then returned slowly, repeating this action at 03:01; however, on this occasion, his return was not captured on camera.
At 03:01, the resident was observed walking along the side of our flat, as recorded by our living room camera.
During this time, he appeared to either spit on our window or blow kisses towards the camera while looking directly at the CCTV.
He then walked past our flat again at a slow pace before returning to the front of our property. He proceeded to walk past our door and towards the end of the bins, this time moving in the direction of the road and out of camera view.
He was subsequently seen returning to his flat, where the loud banging noises resumed for a further 10 to 20 minutes.
Camera footage of these events was recorded between 02:59 and 03:03.
The noise disturbances were intermittent but continued from approximately 02:00 until around 04:00.

Video:

item.title: taking pictures, stalking | 6th November 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:

On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14 were observed:
* At 01:35: no#14 appeared to be recording/photographing us as we left for shopping.
* Shortly after: no#14 was outside, walking towards our bins, then our front door.
* At 14:00: no#14 walked past tour window, observing it and the camera.
* At 20:00: Similar behaviour was noted, with only snapshots captured.
* At 01:00 (Nov 7th): no#14 walked his dog in front of our door, but no footage was recorded due to low light.

The incident has been reported to the police via 101 as advised by WDH Sam Palmer.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On November 6th, 2024, at approximately 01:35, we left to go shopping, we noticed the resident of no#14 standing at his window.
The individual appeared to be holding a phone in a manner suggesting he was recording or photographing us. Upon noticing that he had been seen, the resident of no#14 quickly ducked out of view.
Approximately two minutes after we had left, the resident of #14 was observed walking outside our flat.
He briefly returned before re-emerging, at which point he walked towards our bins aswell as fixating on our front door.
Further observations were made throughout the day:
*At 14:00, the resident of #14 was seen walking past the front room window of our flat, looking at both the windows and our camera.
*A similar observation was made at 20:00 as the resident was leaving his property. Only snapshots of this event were captured by the camera.
*At approximately 01:00 on the 7th, the resident of no#14 returned and took his dog out in front of our door camera. Due to low light conditions, the motion detector did not activate, and no footage was recorded.
*Action Taken:
As advised by WDH Sam Palmer, this incident has been reported to the police for further investigation and documentation.

Video:

item.title: Apprehension of Resident at no#14 | 13th October 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: on October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. Unlike previous attempts, this time they were successful. This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).Â Summery and Details
—-On October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made
—-another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. Unlike previous
—-attempts, this time they were successful. This action followed numerous
—-unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).
—-The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law
—-enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).
1. Initial Observation and Notification
â—¦Â Â Â  6:02 PM (00:01 in video): The resident of no#14 was seen returning to his flat.
—-We contacted the police via 101 as previously instructed.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:14 PM (00:14): An officer knocked on our door to confirm the resident of no#14â€™s
—-presence. Lucy confirmed his presence, to which the officer thanked her and
—-walked away.
2. Police Arrival and Initial Attempts
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:16 PM (01:24): A second officer arrived to assist in apprehending the resident.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:17 PM (01:52): An officer was seen looking up at the resident’s windows for
—-visual confirmation.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:17 PM (02:00): Officers knocked on no#14â€™s door.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:17 PM (02:09): Another officer was seen walking around the side of the flats.
3. Escalation of Efforts
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:17 PM – 6:19 PM (02:23): Officers walked back and forth in front of the flats
—-trying to spot the resident at his windows.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:19 PM (02:46): A bang noise, presumably made by an officer, triggered the
—-resident to shout, “The fuck they doing.” Some inaudible talking followed but
—-could not be clearly recorded.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:19 PM (03:13): An officer was seen walking the perimeter of the flats.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:19 PM (03:21): Officers knocked on the door again, triggering dog barks
—-from inside.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:20 PM (03:47): An officer was seen at the front while running sounds were
—-audible from above.
4. Resident’s Evasive Behaviour
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:20 PM (04:18): Running sounds were heard from inside 14 Pine Close, indicating
—-activity.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:21 PM (04:39): An officer walked down the side of the flats; shortly after, sounds
—-of items falling over were heard from above.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:21 PM (05:08): Another police car arrived to assist with apprehending the
—-resident. Officers were seen accessing their vehicleâ€™s boot while discussing the
—-situation.
5. Conversation at our door
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:26 PM – 6:27 PM (08:06 – 08:46): An officer explained they knew the resident
—-was home because they had seen him at the window.
—-They warned Lucy about a potential loud bang if they needed to force entry.
—-Lucy informed them about a dangerous dog that had previously attempted to
—-snatch an officer’s button through the letterbox.
6. Final Apprehension
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:28 PM – 6:32 PM (09:29 – 12:28): Officers continued to stand outside as it got
—-darker. Another police car arrived at this time.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:29 PM (10:42): A large officer was seen shouting at the window.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:30 PM (11:00): An officer could be heard saying “Come Down.”
—-(Repeated x3 and x3 slower in video)
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:32 PM (12:28): The larger officer awaited a response while sounds from above
—-indicated movement.
7. Conclusion of Incident
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:36 PM (13:13): The sound of 14 Pine Closeâ€™s door closing was heard as a police
—-car approached.
â—¦Â Â Â Â 6:36 PM (13:50): Officers escorted the resident into a police vehicle.
â—¦Â Â Â Â At approximately 15 minutes and 20 seconds in video, police cars were seen
—-driving away with the resident inside.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police continues into Third Day | 11th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).Summery and Details
—-On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers
—-made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close.
—-This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to
—-attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has a documented history
—-of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).
Â 1.Â  11:48 AM
—-Officers arrived at the location, as evidenced by photographic documentation.
Â 2.Â  11:50 AM
â€¨—-At 11:50 AM (00:20 into the attached video), officers knocked loudly on the
—-door of 14 Pine Close. The resident ignored this attempt, despite being
—-audible inside the property shortly before and after the knocking.
Â 3.Â  Subsequent Attempts
â—¦Â Â Â Â At 11:50 AM (00:42 in video), officers knocked again, followed by additional
—-knocks at 11:51 AM (01:10 and 01:44 in video).
â—¦Â Â Â Â Shortly after, Lucy answered the door at 11:52 AM (02:55 in video) and spoke
—-with an officer for around 40 seconds before closing the door at 11:53 AM.
Â 4.Â  Continued Ignoring
â—¦Â Â Â Â At 11:54 AM (04:08 in video), officers knocked on number 14 once more
—-but received no response.
â—¦Â Â Â Â Between 11:55 AM and 11:56 AM (04:55 in video), officers were observed
—-walking around the area, looking up at the windows in an attempt to locate
—-the resident but were unsuccessful.
Â 5.Â  Further Attempts to Make Contact
â—¦Â Â Â Â Officers knocked again at 11:58 AM (05:47 in video) and continued to be
—-ignored, with only an aggressive dog barking from within.
â—¦Â Â Â Â Additional knocks occurred at 11:59 AM (06:10 in video) and again at 12:00 PM
—-(06:48 in video). A loud bang was heard from above during this time,
—-indicating the resident’s presence.
â—¦Â Â Â Â Despite further attempts at knocking shortly thereafter
—-(12:00 PM, 07:02 in video), the officers were still ignored.
Â 6.Â  Revisiting Neighbor for Discussion
â—¦Â Â Â Â At 12:02 PM (08:22 in video), officers returned to our door to discuss the
—-situation regarding number 14. During this time, they knocked again on
—-number 14 at 12:03 PM (08:46 in video) but received no response.
â—¦Â Â Â Â Officers returned to speak with Lucy again at 12:03 PM (09:16 in video), where
—-they explained that due to the residentâ€™s continued non-compliance and their
—-inability to confirm his presence, they could not enter the property.
—-They advised that we should call 101 when we are certain of his presence and
—-warn them about the aggressive dog that had previously attempted to
—-snatch an officer’s baton at the letterbox.
Â 7.Â  Conclusion of Visit
â—¦Â Â Â Â The officers left at 12:05 PM (10:48 in video) and were seen driving away
—-at 12:06 PM (11:01 in video).
â—¦Â Â Â Â Additional evidence includes a photo of their arrival at 11:48 AM
—-(11:22 in video) and a video from a living room window showing one officer
—-looking up at the flat windows of number 14 at 11:52 AM (11:33 in video),
—-which also displayed egg residue from prior incidents.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police again | 10th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 10, 2024, at 10:38 AM, officers attempted to apprehend a resident at 14 Pine Close following multiple...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On October 10, 2024, at 10:38 AM, officers attempted to apprehend a resident at 14 Pine Close following multiple failed requests for a voluntary appearance
— The resident had a history of non-compliance with law enforcement
——– and housing authorities
—— â—‰10:39 AM: Officers knocked forcefully on the door of number 14.
——– Despite audible activity inside, there was no response
—— â—‰10:40 AM: Officers knocked on our door to inquire about the resident,
——– but we had left for shopping 20 minutes earlier
——â—‰ 10:42 AM: After receiving no response, the officers departed.
——– As they drove away, sounds of movement were captured from
——– the upper floor of number 14

Details:
On October 10, 2024, at approximately 10:38AM, officers arrived at 14 Pine Close to attempt apprehension of the resident. This action followed multiple unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has an established history of non-compliance with both law enforcement agencies and housing authorities (WDH).
1. 10:39 AM (01:14 in attached video): Officers knocked forcefully on the door of number 14. The resident appeared to be present but non-responsive, as evidenced by audible activity within the premises both before and after the officers’ attempt to make contact.
2. 10:40 AM (02:06 in attached video): Officers proceeded to knock on our door to inquire about the resident of number 14. However we had left for a shopping approximately 20 minutes prior.
3. 10:42 AM (04:03 and 05:21 in attached video, from different camera angles): After receiving no response, the officers departed the premises. As they drove away, the video captured sounds of movement from the upper floor of number 14.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police and Emerging After They Leave | 09th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 09, 2024, police made two attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close due to...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On October 09, 2024, police made two attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close due to ongoing non-compliance with requests to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).
—1. First attempt 8:58 AM
——â—‰Police arrived and knocked on the resident’s door multiple times, as documented in the attached video.
——â—‰ Officers also spoke with Lucy about the tenant of flat no#14.
——â—‰ After nearly an hour of attempts, they left at approximately 9:51 AM without making contact.
—2. Second attempt 12:41 PM
——â—‰ Officers returned and again knocked on the door but received no response.
——â—‰ They consulted with Lucy once more before leaving at 12:47 PM.
—Subsequent behavior:
——â—‰ The resident has a history of ignoring both police and WDH requests.
——â—‰ Sounds were heard from within Flat #14 throughout the day,
——– indicating the resident’s presence.
——â—‰ The resident was observed leaving the flat 4 minutes after police departure.

Details:
On October 09, 2024, at approximately 8:57AM, officers arrived at Pine Close and made two separate attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close following numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA)
This was not their first attempt, this resident has a history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH)
First Attempt – 8:58 AM
Officers arrived at the premises at 8:58 AM, as documented in the attached video at 6:52. They repeatedly knocked on the door of Flat #14, audible in the recording at 00:32 and several times thereafter.
â€¢ At 01:06, officers knocked on our door.
â€¢ At 01:45, officers spoke with Lucy, regarding the tenant of Flat #14.
â€¢ Multiple attempts were made to contact the resident of Flat #14.
â€¢ At 09:26 in the video (corresponding to 4:53 AM real-time), officers departed after nearly an hour of attempted contact.
â€¢ sounds of banging and movement were audible from within Flat #14, indicating the resident’s presence.
Second Attempt – 12:41 PM
Law enforcement returned to the location at 12:41 PM, as seen in the video at 09:36. During this attempt:
â€¢ At 10:22 in the video, officers knocked on the door of Flat #14 but received no response.
â€¢ At 12:05 in the video, officers again consulted with Lucy regarding the resident of Flat #14.
â€¢ After further unsuccessful attempts to make contact, the police left the premises at 12:47 PM, visible in the video at 15:47.
â€¢ At 03:51PM (real-time), approximately four minutes after police departure, the resident was observed leaving the flat. This is visible in the attached video at 16:57.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police Presence Then Walking Outside Shortly After Their Departure | 28th September 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On September 28, 2024, police made two attempts to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment for the resident of flat #14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On September 28, 2024, police made two attempts to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment for the resident of flat #14 at Pine Close:
—1. First attempt 11:05 AM
——â—‰ Officers arrived at 11:05 AM
——â—‰ Officers left at 11:09 AM
——â—‰ Resident briefly exited with dog, then quickly returned upon seeing police
—2.Second attempt 3:49 PM:
——â—‰ Officers arrived at 3:49 AM
——â—‰ Resident seen in window but ignored officers
——â—‰ Police left at 3:52 PM
Subsequent behavior:
–—â—‰ Resident remained in flat for 6 hours with intermittent noise disturbances
—–â—‰ From 9:30 PM onwards, resident observed:
——â—‰ Walking around outside repeatedly
——â—‰ Looking through our window as passing at 10:32 PM
——â—‰ Briefly returning to flat, then continuing to walk around outside

Details:
On September 28, 2024, at approximately 11:05 AM, officers arrived at Pine Close in an attempt to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment (VA) for the resident of flat no#14. This was not their first attempt, as the resident has a history of ignoring both the police and WDH.
The officers departed at precisely 11:09 AM. Less than one minute later, the resident was observed exiting his flat with his dog.
Upon noticing a police vehicle driving down a street out of camera view, he was seen hastily returning to his flat, pulling the dog along.
At 3:49 PM, nearly five hours after the initial attempt, the police returned to make another effort to communicate with the resident of flat no#14.
This time, they waited longer than before and the officers became aware that the resident was present and deliberately ignoring them, as he was spotted in the window and overheard shouting at his dog for barking.
At 3:52 PM, after being ignored once again, the police left the premises.
Subsequently, the resident remained inside the apartment for approximately six hours, during which time intermittent stomping, banging, and shouting were heard.
from 9:30 PM, the resident of flat no#14 was observed walking around outside our flat on multiple occasions over several hours.
At 10:32 PM, he can be seen looking through our window while passing our flat.
Following this, he returned to his apartment briefly, where stomping noises were heard for a couple of minutes. He then came back outside and continued to walk around.
